DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text designation of the type of radiation therapy delivered to an individual.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the practiced series of actions completed for therapeutic radiation using visible, laser, or ultraviolet light.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Scientific or clinical procedures and methods.

Concepts.definition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation.

Concepts.definition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A single unit of electromagnetic radiation, generally considered to be a discrete particle having no mass or charge.: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: A single unit of electromagnetic radiation, generally considered to be a discrete particle having no mass or charge.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Two Dimension External Beam Radiation Therapy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Two Dimension External Beam Radiation Therapy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.: Dimension; the magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.: (ray-dee-AY-shun) Radiation therapy that uses a machine to aim high-energy rays at the cancer.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.
Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of external radiation therapy that uses special equipment to position the patient and precisely give a single large dose of radiation to a tumor. It is used to treat brain tumors and other brain disorders that cannot be treated by regular surgery. It is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.

Concepts.definition: A non-surgical procedure that was developed to deliver one or several maximum dose targeted radiation treatments for cancers in the brain or spine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The property of being measured and described using three orthogonal directions.: (ray-dee-AY-shun) Radiation therapy that uses a machine to aim high-energy rays at the cancer.

Concepts.definition: The property of being measured and described using three orthogonal directions.
Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.

Concepts.definition: Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (ray-dee-AY-shun) Radiation therapy that uses a machine to aim high-energy rays at the cancer.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy

Concepts.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Use of a computer and scanning devices to create three-dimensional pictures.: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: Use of a computer and scanning devices to create three-dimensional pictures.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Radiation therapy using electron beam.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with accurate, high doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary implants.

Concepts.definition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with accurate, high doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary implants.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with low doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary or permanent implants.

Concepts.definition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with low doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary or permanent implants.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of proton beam radiation therapy in which complex spatial control of the proton beam is achieved through modulation of the dose, deflection, and penetration.

Concepts.definition: A type of proton beam radiation therapy in which complex spatial control of the proton beam is achieved through modulation of the dose, deflection, and penetration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of external beam radiation therapy using a beam of protons. It has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.

Concepts.definition: A type of external beam radiation therapy using a beam of protons. It has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The property of being measured and described using three orthogonal directions.: Radiation therapy using photon beam.

Concepts.definition: The property of being measured and described using three orthogonal directions.
Radiation therapy using photon beam.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The property of being measured and described using two orthogonal directions.: Radiation therapy using photon beam.

Concepts.definition: The property of being measured and described using two orthogonal directions.
Radiation therapy using photon beam.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition.
